file_content.text: This area is going to be a tug of war. It's a good thing you saved those men--we're going to need everyone we can get.
Your men have been released, and the enemy is on the run.
I hope my men are still alive. I'm waiting for your signal that all is secure.
If you have men in danger, you'd better stop berating yourself and do something.
Start acting like an officer.
That is a Jedi philosophy as well, Captain.
We don't abandon our allies.
If soldiers are in danger, you'd better stop whining and do something.
Buck up, Captain.
I sometimes make a habit of pulling Republic soldiers' butts out of the fire.
Maybe I can help.
Go on the attack.
Those men deserve every effort. But what's left of my forces couldn't come close to success.
It would be suicide for us. I'd just end up getting more good soldiers captured and killed.
Sounds terrible.
Something must be done. My men deserve a chance.
You got it.
Then there's hope. You're an inspiration.
I'm doing this for your men, not for you.
I'll fix your mess.
You're right, I failed them. It'll haunt me.
I just made it out of there. Please give me some space so I can gather my wits.
Agent Moritt is waiting for you!
You're here! Master Jedi, you made it! You're just in time!
Major! You actually made it! I can't tell you how glad I am to see you, sir--we're in a real mess here!
You! You're the one Agent Poz told me about--you made it! We really need your help!
I'm Captain Devlin, First Recon. We had established a beachhead and started data collection, just like the SIS ordered, but then we got swarmed!
It was those blasted Esh-kha. We fell back to here, but some of my people didn't make it. No telling what those freaks are doing to them....
Please--get my men out of there. We'll need their help to hold this position, and you'd be be landing a good first strike on those Esh-kha monsters.
We'll see.
Please--don't leave them to die. Not like that.
We'll hold here and keep our eyes open. If you manage to save anyone, come on back and let me know.
Good luck--and thank you.
You did it! You actually did it! I can't thank you enough.
We'll make sure the survivors get patched up. You keep pushing ahead and contact me from one of the deeper monitoring stations.
By the time you're in position, we should have a lead on the main Esh-kha force. Watch your back.
